laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count was 10,900 per cubic millimeter, with 77% neutrophils, 16% lymphocytes, 6% monocytes, and 2% eosinophils; the remainder of the complete blood count was normal.
Creatinine level was 1.6 mg per deciliter (144 μmol per liter), compared with a baseline level of 1.0 mg per deciliter (88 μmol per liter).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Rising creatinine levels from 1.0 mg/dL to 1.6 mg/dL.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Blood urea nitrogen level was 15 mg per deciliter (5.4 mmol per liter); sodium 135 mmol per liter; potassium 5.4 mmol per liter.
Substantial disruption of the myocytes, with dense, predominantly mononuclear inflammation, a thickened endocardium, and multiple giant cells.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat endomyocardial biopsy 2 months later revealed no evidence of active myocarditis.
